alert.note: Alert for Beaver; Texas (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 12:30PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Beaver, southeastern Texas, north central Hutchinson, Hansford, southeastern Sherman and northwestern Ochiltree Counties through 130 PM CDT... At 1230 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Elmwood to 11 miles northwest of Morse. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Perryton, Spearman, Beaver, Gruver, Hardesty, Elmwood, Morse, Bryans Corner, Farnsworth, Boyd, Waka and Balko. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
